intro: Pancheria calophylla, commonly known as the white-flowered pancheria, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Pancheria calophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
